result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L. Huggins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court authorizes transfer of probation to Jefferson County.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE, schooling or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with R.M., D.M., D.M. or Pine River Merchantile

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

DNA sample.  Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher L. Huggins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 9:37 am 
INCLUDES 15CM1537 AND 15CM1949. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty Kat Jackan.  

INITIAL APPEARANCE IN 15CM1949. 
Def has received copy of the complaint. 
Complaint read. 

PLEA HEARING IN 15CM1537 AND 15CM1949. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to: 
In 15CM1949: Ct. 1 (Criminal Damage to Property/Repeater)>>AMEND to DC/Repeater pursuant to 947.01(1). 
                       : Ct. 2 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: In 15CM1537: Ct. 1 (Retail Theft/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
          : In 15CM1949: Amended Ct. 1 (DC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 18 months probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; Letters of apology to R.M, D.M, and D.M; No contact with R.M, D.M, D.M, or Pine River Mercantile; DNA sample and surcharge; court costs. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit in 15CM1949 and 1 day jail credit in 15CM1537 if revoked. 
COURT authorizes transfer of probation to Jefferson County. 

Adj: 9:53 am
